info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 15 at 3:18PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Henderson County through 345 PM EDT... At 318 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Hendersonville, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hendersonville, Flat Rock, Mountain Home, Laurel Park, Saluda, Dupont State Forest, Valley Hill, Tuxedo, Edneyville and Crab Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
